intro: Grammatopteridium pseudodrymoglossum, commonly known as the false drymoglossum, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Pottiaceae. It is a cryptogamic plant characterized by its small, closely packed leaves that form a dense, cushion-like growth. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in temperate regions with high humidity. Its reproductive structures, known as capsules, are borne on short, lateral branches and release spores when mature. Grammatopteridium pseudodrymoglossum plays a role in soil stabilization and provides microhabitat for various small invertebrates.
